{
    "number": 287313,
    "data": "19,29,59,79,89,983,1229,1721,2131,2213,2377,2459,3361,3607,3853,4099,4591,4673,4919,5657,5821,5903,6067,60589,64969,65699,70079,72269,76649,78839,83219,86869,91249,94169,95629,102199,102929,107309,108769,113149,117529,118259",
    "name": "Primes that can be generated by the concatenation in base 9, in descending order, of two consecutive integers read in base 10.",
    "example": [
        "1 and 2 in base 9 are 1 and 2 and concat(21) = 21 in base 10 is 19;",
        "8 and 9 in base 9 are 8 and 10 and concat(10,8) = 108 in base 10 is 89."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "with(numtheory): P:= proc(q,h) local a,b,c,d,k,n; a:=convert(q+1,base,h); b:=convert(q,base,h); c:=[op(a),op(b)]; d:=0; for k from nops(c) by -1 to 1 do d:=h*d+c[k]; od; if isprime(d) then d; fi; end: seq(P(i,9),i=0..1000);"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "With[{b = 9}, Select[Map[FromDigits[Flatten@ IntegerDigits[#, b], b] &, Reverse /@ Partition[Range[0, 165], 2, 1]], PrimeQ]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 25 2017 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000040, A052089."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Paolo P. Lava_, May 24 2017",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 6,
    "time": "2017-05-28T09:35:36-04:00",
    "created": "2017-05-28T09:35:36-04:00"
}
